results.title: Power and corruption
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This specially edited version of Polanski’s “Macbeth” focuses on the dramatic chain of events precipitated by Macbeth’s killing of Duncan, his king. One of the results of the sinister murder is that Macbeth is crowned King of Scotland in an impressive ceremony at Scone. The other fruits of his action, however, are bitter, for Macbeth has to learn that power illegally gained corrupts no one so much as him who gets it.

results.title: Power among men
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information, Julien Bryan and Thorold Dickinson
results.brief_description: This is the first feature-length film to deal with the idea and purposes of the UN. It is a film about two forces which co-exist in humankind; power to build and power to destroy. Man prides himself on being the builder of civilisations. He cannot deny that he is an equally effective destroyer. The film leaves the viewer with the knowledge that it is up to man himself to make the choice. In sequences filmed in Italy, Haiti, Norway and Canada the film shows how man’s abilities have been put to use and how his powers have been applied. The positive need for human beings to find lasting solutions to the problems of controlling their destructive power is dramatically illustrated.

results.title: Power
results.brief_description: Power system in automobiles. Cylinder; piston operation; 4-cycle action of intake, compression, power and exhaust; differences between 1, 4 and 6 cylinder engines; power turning the wheels. Animated diagrams assist the explanations.

results.title: Powaqqatsi: Life in transformation [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Golan-Globus, Mel Lawrence, Godfrey Reggio and Lawrence Taub
results.brief_description: A feast for the eyes and ears - “Powaqqatsi: life in transformation” is a spellbinding look at life on our planet from the depths of an iron ore mine in Brazil, to the commotion of city life in the concrete jungle of Hong Kong. Featuring hypnotic music by renowned composer Philip Glass, this is a truly amazing and totally original experience in modern cinema.

results.title: Poverty, child health & child labour
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores the socioeconomic factors that have historically played a powerful role in children’s lives, and contrasts the decline in infant/child mortality and child labour in industrialised societies. Child labour in Guatemala provides one of several examples of the harsh economic circumstances in which many children still live.

results.title: Poverty and plenty
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dick, John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Commonwealth of Nations”.
The ancient greatness of he East must be preserved, say men like Nehru, “but the ancient evils must be eliminated.” This film concerns itself with the latter and shows how helping the Asiatic countries of the Commonwealth to attain higher living standards has become a challenge not only to the more privileged countries within the Commonwealth but to the nations outside. The Colombo Plan is the medium through which economic assistance is extended, and in this film we see some of the many practical forms it takes.
